name: html_to_markdown
description: Fetch HTML from a URL or convert provided HTML content to Markdown format. Automatically extracts and converts web pages to clean, readable Markdown. Use this whenever you need to fetch and extract information from a webpage.

arguments.name: url
arguments.desc: URL to fetch HTML from. If provided, the HTML will be automatically fetched and converted. Either 'url' or 'html' must be provided.

arguments.name: html
arguments.desc: Raw HTML content to convert to Markdown. Use this if you already have HTML content. Either 'url' or 'html' must be provided.

arguments.name: includeMetadata
arguments.desc: Include metadata header (source URL, title, and timestamp) in the output

arguments.name: maxLength
arguments.desc: Maximum length of the returned markdown content in characters. If the content exceeds this length, it will be truncated with a message indicating the truncation.

arguments.name: saveToFile
arguments.desc: Optional file path to save the full markdown content to. When specified, the full content is saved to the file and a summary is returned instead of the full content.

name: save_markdown
description: Save markdown content to a file. Use this to persist converted HTML to a markdown file on disk.

arguments.name: filePath
arguments.desc: The file path where the markdown should be saved (can be relative or absolute)
